title: Invasive Species: We Asked, You Answered
description: We couldn't stop at the spotted lanternfly! (We covered that invasive species in an earlier episode.) We wanted to hear about the invasives where you live. You wrote us about cane toads in Australia, zebra mussels in Nevada; borers, beetles, adelgids, stinkbugs, and so many more. From your emails, we picked three invaders to talk about with NPR science correspondent Dan Charles. Follow host Maddie Sofia on Twitter @maddie_sofia. Email the show at shortwave@npr.org.
copyright: Copyright 2019-2021 NPR - For Personal Use Only
itunes:title: Invasive Species: We Asked, You Answered
itunes:author: NPR
itunes:summary: So many critters and plants in places they should not be.
itunes:subtitle: So many critters and plants in places they should not be.
